thread.title: Harvard crushes Cornell football to keep Big Red winless
thread.title_full: Harvard crushes Cornell football to keep Big Red winless | syracuse.com

author: The Associated Press
title: Harvard crushes Cornell football to keep Big Red winless
text:
Ithaca, N.Y. â€” Scott Hosch threw three touchdown passes and ran for another score and Harvard beat Cornell 40-3 on Saturday to win its 18th straight game.
&raquo Box score
The Crimson (4-0, 2-0 Ivy League) outgained Cornell (0-4, 0-2) 499 total yards to 192 and converted one of three interceptions and a fumble into scores.
Hosch was 14 of 30 for 244 yards, with TD strikes of 47 yards to Ben Braunecker, 19 yards to Anthony Firkser and 46 yards to Justice Shelton-Mosely. Hosch also scored on a 3-yard run in the fourth quarter.
Paul Stanton Jr. gained 101 yards on 17 carries and scored on a 2-yard run.
The Crimson defense held Big Red leading rusher Luke Hagy to 33 yards on 15 carries and Luke Hutton, Eric Ryan and Jordan Becerra each grabbed interceptions.
The victory is Harvard's 13th consecutive Ivy League win and 10th straight win over Cornell dating back to 2006.
